text: Characterization of an immediate-early gene induced in adherent monocytes that encodes I kappa B-like activity .
We have cloned a group of cDNAs representing mRNAs that are rapidly induced following adherence of human monocytes .

One of the induced transcripts ( <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) encodes a protein of 317 amino acids with one domain containing five tandem repeats of the cdc10 / ankyrin motif , which is 60 % similar ( 46 % identical ) to the ankyrin repeat region of the precursor of NF-kappa B / <extra_id_0> KBF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The C-terminus has a putative protein kinase C phosphorylation site .

In vitro translated <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein was found to specifically inhibit the DNA - binding activity of the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> NF-kappa B complex but not that of the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> KBF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> factor or of other DNA - binding proteins .

text: The <extra_id_0> MAD-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cDNA encodes an I kappa B-like protein that is likely to be involved in regulation of transcriptional responses to NF-kappa B , including adhesion - dependent pathways of monocyte activation .
